meanings.sent1: The discomposed child couldn't focus on their homework.
meanings.sent2: She looked discomposed after hearing the scary story.
meanings.sent3: The discomposed puppy kept chasing its own tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: His discomposed thoughts were like a stormy sea in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The discomposed forest was filled with rustling leaves and eerie sounds.

meanings.definition: To disturb the order or arrangement of
meanings.sent1: Please do not discompose the carefully arranged books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise discomposed the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loves to discompose the neatly stacked papers.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected visit discomposed his plans for the evening.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind discomposed the neatly arranged hair on her head.

meanings.definition: To put out of place; disarrange
meanings.sent1: The mischievous child tried to discompose the puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind discomposed the carefully arranged picnic setup.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy managed to discompose the neatly made bed.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected phone call discomposed her thoughts and focus.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous squirrel discomposed the garden by digging up the flower bulbs.
